sen.j: 六条 有房（ろくじょう ありふさ、建長3年（1251年）－元応元年7月2日_(旧暦)（1319年7月19日））は、鎌倉時代後期の公卿・歌人。
sen.e: Arifusa ROKUJO (1251 – July 19, 1319) was a noble and poet in the late Kamakura Period.
Arifusa ROKUJO (1251 – July 19, 1319) was a noble and a poet during the late Kamakura Period.
Arifusa ROKUJO (1251–July 27, 1319) was Kugyo (a Court noble) and a poet during the late Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除。日付を修正。「公卿」を修正

sen.j: 父は六条家の祖である右近衛大将六条通有（久我通光の子）、母は藤原清定の娘。
sen.e: His father was Michiari ROKUJO (the son of Michiteru KOGA) who was the founder of the Rokujo family and mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Kiyosada.
His father was Michiari ROKUJO (the son of Michiteru KOGA) who was the founder of the Rokujo family and his mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Kiyosada.

His father was Michiari ROKUJO, Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), (the son of Michiteru KOGA) who was the founder of the Rokujo family and his mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Kiyosada.

sen.j: 子には六条有忠（千種忠顕の父）がいる。
sen.e: Aritada ROKUJO (the father of Tadaki CHIKUSA) was his child.

sen.j: 従一位内大臣にまで昇った。
sen.e: Arifusa rose to Juichii rank, Naidaijin minister.

sen.j: 村上源氏の名門の出であるが、幼くして父・通有が病死する。
sen.e: Arifusa was from the distinguished Murakami-Genji family but his father Michiari died of natural causes in Arifusa's early childhood.

Arifusa was from the distinguished Murakami-Genji family but his father Michiari died of illness in Arifusa's early childhood.

sen.j: 通有は未だ正四位下右近衛大将であったために出世は望めなかった。
sen.e: With Michiari being only Shoshiinoge, Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) at his death, there was a little hope for Arifusa's career advancement.

sen.j: このため、公卿である従三位非参議となったのは48歳の時であった。
sen.e: Consequently, Arifusa was 48 years of age at his appointment as Junior Third Rank, non-Councilor joining the ranks of nobles.

sen.j: ところが、大覚寺統の後宇多上皇が院政を開始すると院近臣として登用されて急速に昇進し、正安3年（1301年）に左大弁兼参議となると、嘉元元年（1303年）には権中納言に昇進して後に院伝奏を兼ね、延慶 (日本)元年（1308年）には権大納言に達した。
sen.e: When the retired Emperor Gouda of Daikakuji-to (Imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) started the cloistered government, gaining the appointment as a close aide to the retired emperor, Arifusa began to advance rapidly whereby after gaining the double assignments of Sadaiben (major controller of the left) and Sangi (Councilor) in 1301, was promoted to Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Councilor) in 1303 which was followed by an additional post of the indenso (a job title to relay messages of court people to the retired emperor) climbing to the post of Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Councilor) in 1308.

When the retired Emperor Gouda of Daikakuji-to (Imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) started the cloistered government, gaining the appointment as a close aide to the retired emperor, Arifusa began to advance rapidly whereby after gaining the double assignments of Sadaiben (major controller of the left) and Sangi (Councilor) in 1301, was promoted to Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Councilor) in 1303 which was followed by an additional post of the indenso (a job title to relay messages of court people to the retired emperor) climbing to the post of Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Councilor) in 1308.

When the retired Emperor Gouda of Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) started the cloister government, gaining the appointment as a In no Kinshin (the retired Emperor's courtier), Arifusa began to advance rapidly whereby after gaining the double assignments of Sadaiben (major controller of the left) and Sangi (councilor) in 1301, was promoted to Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1303 which was followed by an additional post of the indenso (a job title to relay messages of court people to the retired emperor) climbing to the post of Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) in 1308.
sen.cmt: Imperial, Councilor を小文字に。「院政、院近臣、権中納言、権大納言」を修正。

sen.j: また、二条為世に師事して和歌を学ぶ。
sen.e: Arifusa, in the meantime, studied waka (Japanese poetry) under Tameyo NIJO.

sen.j: 『増鏡』には「この中将才かしこくて末の世にはことの他にもてなされて」云々と記され、当時の歌壇では寵児的存在だったと推察されている。
sen.e: In Masukagami ("The Clear Mirror"), there is a description saying, "This Chujo (Middle Captain) excelled in scholarship and was appointed to important posts particularly in his later years …" suggesting that Arifusa was a darling of the poetry circle of the time.

sen.j: 為世とともに大覚寺統側の歌壇で活躍し、その影響下で『野守鏡』（永仁3年（1295年）、但し異説あり）を著し、持明院統側の京極為兼の歌を激しく論難した。
sen.e: Arifusa and Tameyo played an active role in the Daikakuji-to poetry circle and, under the influence of Tameyo, Arifusa wrote Nomorinokagami (in 1295 albeit there is heresy concerning the year), making scathing attack on the poems of Tamekane KYOGOKU who belonged to the Jitoin-to (the Imperial lineage starting with Empeor Jito) group.

sen.j: その後政権が持明院統に移ったために再び不遇となるが、文保2年1月11日_(旧暦)（1318年2月12日）には従一位に叙せられる。
sen.e: Afterwards, with the administration was transferred to Jitoin-to, Arifusa once again became obscure but was conferred Joichii (Junior First Rank) on February 12, 1318.

sen.j: 翌元応元年（1319年）、後醍醐天皇の即位によって後宇多上皇の院政が再開された時、有房は病の床にあった。
sen.e: In 1319, when the cloistered government by the retired Emperor Gouda resumed with Emperor Godaigo's accession to the throne, Arifusa was confined to bed of sickness.
In 1319, when the cloistered government by the retired Emperor Gouda resumed with Emperor Godaigo's accession to the throne, Arifusa was sick and confined to bed.

sen.j: だが、後宇多上皇の希望により、同年6月28日_(旧暦)に突然、一条内経が内大臣を更迭されて既に危篤状態であった有房が後任とされた。
sen.e: On June 28 of the same year, however, at the request of the retired Emperor Gouda, Uchitsune ICHIJO was suddenly dismissed from the post of Naidaijin (Minister of the Interior) and Arifusa, who had fallen in critical condition, was named as the successor.

sen.j: 3日後の7月1日_(旧暦)には急遽、後宇多上皇が有房を見舞う。
